author: COMSOL
description: The Schmidtâ€“Cassegrain Telescope demonstrated in this tutorial is a classic design using an aspheric corrector lens and two spherical mirrors. The aspheric corrector is created using the 'Aspheric Even Lens 3D' part from the Ray Optics Module Part Library.
label: schmidt_cassegrain_telescope.mph
name: root

commentsinfile
settings.value:
Aspheric Even Lens 3D

Aspheric lens with either concave or convex surfaces. The surface sag is specified by a conic plus a polynomial defined by the sum of the first 11 even terms. The normalization unit for the aspheric coefficients should be specified. The aspheric surface diameters can be smaller than the outer lens diameter. Clear apertures which are smaller than the surface diameters can be also specified.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Spherical Mirror 3D

Spherical mirror. The mirror surface may be either concave or convex. A central hole may or may not be present. A clear aperture which is smaller than the mirror surface diameter can be specified.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Circular Planar Annulus

Circular planar annulus with negligible thickness.
